author: FLPat Community
title: Biden MUST do Weekly Televised Town Halls!
text: Other than the “Vice President Trump” gaffe and maybe a few other minor stumbles, I actually thought Biden did a nice job at the NATO press conference. Up until then I was probably leaning towards the make Harris the nominee camp. But on foreign policy Biden really showed he knows his stuff, and even on domestic questions he did pretty good. So now count me in the “let’s keep Biden a little longer” camp to see if he can turn things around. To help I’d like to offer Joe a suggestion: do a weekly town hall with American voters, both democrats, republicans and independents. Make these weekly and if a cable channel won’t cover it, put it on YouTube. That’s where most people watch videos now anyhow. Do it every Saturday afternoon or night. Remember those Saturday morning radio messages presidents used to do? Bring that back but make it a Town Hall format. Heck, even ask George Clooney, Rob Riner or Jon Stewart to moderate it. Let people see the real Joe that apparently people around him see. Town Halls like this are something that Trump would never do. If Joe does them every week I think it would really move the needle on his favorability rating. He should have been doing these all along during his term. And one more tip Joe: If anyone asks you about a gaffe or flub you made or make, just say “You know, I admit I make a gaffe every now and then. I guess I’m the gaffe candidate. But Trump is both the gaffe AND the liar candidate so who would you really want as your president?”

author: Luke PHILLIPS
title: Nuguse wins top-quality Zurich re-run of Olympic 1500m final
text:
American Yared Nuguse offered up a perfectly-timed attack to claim victory in a top-quality re-run of the Olympic final to win the men's 1500m at the Zurich Diamond League on Thursday.
Nuguse, who claimed bronze in the Paris Games, outstripped Norway's Jakob Ingebrigtsen for the win in 3min 29.21sec.
Nuguse's US teammate and Olympic champion Cole Hocker finished third, while Dutch runner Niels Laros came in fourth, with world champion Josh Kerr of Britain in fifth.
"This race was so highly anticipated and I knew that it was going to be quick in the end," said Nuguse.
"Everyone could have got this race. I am glad I was still able to win.
"From the beginning, I just tried not to do any wrong move and to be where I wanted to be and then you need to be ready for the end."
Nuguse added that it had been a "lot less stressful" than the Olympics.
"It is so much more fun running with these guys today!"
Ingebrigtsen beat Hocker in the Lausanne Diamond League, then went on to smash the 3,000m world record in Silesia, but picked up an infection which he said had hampered his preparations for Zurich.
"My race was better than I expected it yesterday. I still have not recovered," the Norwegian said.
"It was worth it to come here and race. But one more week of recovery would have been better for me and given me more stimulation."
Rarely has an event been as keenly contested in recent seasons as the men's 1500m, and so it once again proved in front of a packed Letzigrund Stadium.
Slovenia's Zan Rudolf was the opening pacemaker, taking the pack through the opening lap in 55.61sec.
The pace saw the field strung out in single file almost from the off.
- Fast finish -
Britain's Elliot Giles, fresh from a world record in the road mile race, took over the pace setting, Ingebrigtsen sat on his shoulder, followed by Nuguse, Kerr and Hocker.
Giles stepped aside at the bell for the final lap, Ingebrigtsen in the lead.
Nuguse clung to his coattails, but a gap built on Kerr and the chasing pack.
As Nuguse took on the Norwegian down the home straight, Hocker made a late charge, but it was too late.
Nuguse edged Ingebrigtsen, Hocker coming in third, a different winner only serving to continue pushing the competition in the event.
"Tactically, it is always more difficult when you have a pacer, but it makes it interesting nevertheless," said Hocker.
"In races like this, with such a field, it makes you appreciate even more when you win or do well."
Going into the Paris Olympics, the narrative had all been about Ingebrigtsen avenging his world championships loss to Kerr.
Even World Athletics president Sebastian Coe, himself a two-time Olympic 1500m champion and whose career involved an intense rivalry with Steve Ovett, dubbed the tug-of-war between the two tremendous for the sport.
"It has an added piquancy because this is probably not a friendship made in heaven," Coe said.
Kerr and Ingebrigtsen have traded barbs since the Scot swept past the Norwegian to snatch world gold in Budapest last year.
But both were upstaged at the Paris Games as the unheralded Hocker surged home for gold ahead of Kerr, Nuguse taking bronze ahead of Ingebrigtsen.

author: Jeanne A. Becker
title: Business Litigator and Commercial Transactions Attorney Jason E. Rosen Joins Hinshaw's Miami Office as a Partner
text:
The U.S. law firm of Hinshaw & Culbertson LLP is pleased to announce it has bolstered its Commercial Litigation and Commercial Transactions practice groups with the addition of Jason E. Rosen as a partner in the firm’s Miami office.
“Hinshaw is pleased to welcome Jason’s diverse practices and ensure that he takes full advantage of Hinshaw’s national platform, practice support, and other growth synergies,” said Anthony J. Jacob, chair of Hinshaw’s Commercial Transaction Practice Group. “Our existing clients in Florida, Latin America, and across the United States will also benefit greatly from Jason’s experience in high-stakes disputes, investigations, his strong approach to negotiations, as well as acting as outside counsel to a wide range of businesses from startups to established enterprises.”
A former securities trader and financial advisor, Jason is a trusted advocate for his business clients, representing their interests as a litigator, corporate transactional lawyer, and Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS). As a business litigator, Jason represents clients on contracts, partnerships, shareholder issues, and business torts. On the transactional side, Jason provides practical, forward-thinking guidance on day-to-day operations and corporate deals, on issues ranging from entity formation and governance to contract drafting, vendor negotiations, and mergers and acquisitions.
A third-generation lawyer, Jason founded his own boutique business law firm and worked alongside his father, Michael J. Rosen, in a national white-collar defense firm based in Miami. Jason’s grandfather was E. David Rosen, a renowned legal lion in Florida focusing on criminal tax defense, who began his legal career as a federal prosecutor in the mid-1950s and represented Meyer Lansky, among many other well-known clients. “My grandfather was a legend in the courtroom,” added Jason. “Naturally, he and my father helped inspire in me a passion for courtroom practice and zealously representing the interests of my clients.”
Prior to joining Hinshaw, Jason was the managing partner of an international law firm’s United States office.
Jason speaks Spanish and is admitted in California, Florida, New York, North Carolina, South Carolina, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit, and the U.S. District Courts for the Central District of California, the Southern District of Florida, and the Northern District of Ohio. His professional affiliations include the American Bar Association and The Florida Bar, Business Law Section. Jason was recognized as a Rising Star in the South Carolina Super Lawyers magazine from 2019 – 2022 and as a Rising Star in the Florida Super Lawyers magazine in 2018. Jason holds a J.D. from Florida International University College of Law and a B.S. from Florida State University.
Hinshaw & Culbertson LLP is a U.S.-based law firm with offices nationwide. The firm’s national reputation spans the insurance industry, the financial services sector, professional services, and other highly regulated industries. Hinshaw provides holistic legal solutions—from litigation and dispute resolution and business advisory and transactional services to regulatory compliance—for clients of all sizes. Visit www.hinshawlaw.com for more information and follow @Hinshaw on LinkedIn and X.

author: xda-developers.com
title: Noida: Classes Up To 8 Suspended Until Further Orders Due To Cold
text:
Gautam Buddh Nagar administration has suspended classes for students up to grade 8 in all schools until further notice due to dense fog and extreme cold. PTI Updated: Friday, January 03, 2025, 11:56 AM IST
Representative Image Gautam Buddh Nagar administration on Thursday ordered suspension of classes till 8 in all schools of the district until further orders in view of cold weather conditions.
The order, issued by District Basic Education Officer Rahul Panwar, applies to schools across board affiliations.
"In compliance with the instructions given by the District Magistrate, Gautam Buddh Nagar, in view of the dense fog and extreme cold, there will be a holiday in all the schools (classes from nursery to 8) recognized by all the boards (CBSE / ICSE / IB, UP Board and others) operating in the district with immediate effect till further orders. The said order should be strictly followed," the order stated.
Read Also Winter Vacation 2024: Schools Announce Winter Break Dates, Check When Your State Is Closed Tesla Annual Deliveries Drop, And So Do Elon Musk-Led Company's Shares Kunal Kamra Shares First Pic Of Umar Khalid Out On Interim Bail, Says 'Heart Knows No Concept Of Time' Viral VIDEO: Jaipur Govt Officer's Minor Son Rams Thar Into Sikh Procession, Several Injured; Angry Mob Vandalises Jeep A maximum of 17 degrees Celsius was recorded in the district, with the IMD predicting foggy and misty condition.
The Met has predicted a low of 8 degrees Celsius on Friday.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 房地产ETF基金（515060）跌1.73%，半日成交额1310.91万元|房地产_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，房地产ETF基金（515060）跌1.73%，报0.626元，成交额1310.91万元。房地产ETF基金（515060）重仓股方面， 保利发展 截止午盘跌1.87%， 万科A 跌2.02%， 招商蛇口 跌1.50%， 海南机场 跌1.20%， 张江高科 跌1.38%， 金地集团 跌3.23%， 滨江集团 跌0.11%， 衢州发展 跌1.54%， 华发股份 跌1.04%， 华侨城A 跌1.33%。
房地产ETF基金（515060）业绩比较基准为中证全指房地产指数收益率，管理人为华夏基金管理有限公司，基金经理为张金志，成立（2019-11-28）以来回报为-36.36%，近一个月回报为-0.84%。
